name: Atropine Sulfate
indications: atropine sulfate injection indicated temporary blockade severe life-threatening muscariniceffects , e.g . , antisialagogue , antivagal agent , antidote organophosphorus muscarinicmushroom poisoning , treat bradyasystolic cardiac arrest .
contraindications: 2.1 general parenteral products inspected visually particulate matter discoloration prior toadministration , whenever solution container permit . administer unless solution clear andseal intact . syringe intended single dose . discard unused portion.for intravenous administration.titrate based heart rate , pr interval , blood pressure symptoms . 2.2 adult 2.3 pediatric dosing pediatric well studied . usual initial dose 0.01 0.03 mg/kg . 2.4 dosing patients coronary artery disease limit total dose atropine sulfate 0.03 mg/kg 0.04 mg/kg [ ( 5.1 ) ]
warningsAndPrecautions: atropine sulfate injection , usp supplied single-dose syringes follows : store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) ; excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f 86°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature . ] product repackaged : henry schein , inc. , bastian , va 24314 original manufacturer/distributor 's ndc unit sale henry schein repackaged product ndc unit sale total strength/total volume ( concentration ) per unit ndc 0409-9630-05bundle 10ansyr™ plastic syringe ndc 0404-9823-051 ansyr™ plastic syringe bag ( vial bears ndc 0409-9630-15 ) concentration : 0.05 mg/mlfill volume : 5 mltotal atropine content : 0.25 mg distributed hospira , inc. , lake forest , il 60045 usaabboject® trademark abbott laboratories.lifeshield® trademark icu medical , inc. used license . lab-1041-4.2
indications_original: Atropine Sulfate Injection is indicated for temporary blockade of severe or life-threatening muscariniceffects, e.g., as an antisialagogue, an antivagal agent, an antidote for organophosphorus or muscarinicmushroom poisoning, and to treat bradyasystolic cardiac arrest.
contraindications_original:
2.1 General Administration
                     Parenteral drug products should be inspected visually for particulate matter and discoloration prior toadministration, whenever solution and container permit. Do not administer unless solution is clear andseal is intact. Each syringe is intended for single dose only. Discard unused portion.For intravenous administration.Titrate based on heart rate, PR interval, blood pressure and symptoms.
                  
                     
                     2.2 Adult Dosage
                  
                  
                     
                  
                  
                     2.3 Pediatric Dosage
                  
                  Dosing in pediatric populations has not been well studied. Usual initial dose is 0.01 to 0.03 mg/kg.
                     2.4 Dosing in Patients with Coronary Artery Disease
                  
                  Limit the total dose of atropine sulfate to 0.03 mg/kg to 0.04 mg/kg [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)]
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Atropine Sulfate Injection, USP is supplied in single-dose syringes as follows:
                  
                     
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15°C and 30°C (59°F and 86°F).[See USP Controlled Room Temperature.]
                  
                      Product repackaged by: Henry Schein, Inc., Bastian, VA 24314
